pde_description: \begin{cases} \partial_t u = D \nabla^2 u - \frac{I_{fi}(u, v) + I_{so}(u) + I_{si}(u, w)}{C_m} \\ \partial_t v = \begin{cases} \frac{1-v}{\tau_{mv}(u)} & u < V_c \\ \frac{-v}{\tau_{pv}} & u \ge V_c \end{cases} \\ \partial_t w = \begin{cases} \frac{1-w}{\tau_{mw}} & u < V_c \\ \frac{-w}{\tau_{pw}} & u \ge V_c \end{cases} \end{cases} \\ \text{where:} \\ I_{fi}(u, v) = \frac{-v H(u - V_c) (u - V_c) (1 - u)}{\tau_d} \\ I_{so}(u) = \frac{u(1 - H(u - V_c))}{\tau_0} + \frac{H(u - V_c)}{\tau_r} \\ I_{si}(u, w) = \frac{-w(1 + \tanh(k(u - V_{csi})))}{2\tau_{si}} \\ \tau_{mv}(u) = (1-H(u-V_v))\tau_{v1} + H(u-V_v)\tau_{v2}
notes: Use 2nd order central differences for the spatial discretization. Enforce boundary conditions at every time step. To maintain stability, internal time-stepping smaller than the required output intervals should be considered. The definition for tau_mv(u) was inferred from the provided parameters as it was not explicitly defined in the PDE system.
